attributes.action: challenge the European Union on its decision to allow Spain to control Gibraltarian water in the name of environmental protection
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On the 31st May 2009, the Spanish government tricked the EU into granting them control over Gibraltarian waters. The Spanish challenge British rule on the rock, and by granting them the ability to patrol the waters of Gibraltar as part of its environmental protection zone, the EU has recognised Spains claim to these waters, as a nation cannot claim for waters that it does not own.
Having held the rock of Gibraltar for over 300 years after the Treaty of Utrecht, it is not right that the government is not activly and publically tackling this challenge to its sovereignty of Gibraltar. We the undersigned, would like the Prime Minister to take a more active and public stance.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
